title: No children nodes listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children nodes are listed.
EB: When changing the data source, the new data source's children nodes should be listed.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source. 4. Notice that the new data source does not display any database/table/column information. Actual result: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
